result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin K Buerke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to prison term being served.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

Pay costs of the action.  Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin K Buerke

records.addlTxt: for withdrawal of counsel
from Defendant regarding motion/petition

Defendant Kevin K Buerke in court, in custody. Sara Siefert appeared on behalf of Dept. of Corrections. Court reviews letters, motions filed by Defendant, provides summary of understanding of Defendant's request. Court advises Defendant that inquiry should be addressed to administrative law judge, and if no relief is provided, inquiries should be made to Marinette County Court. Defendant understands. Court encourages Defendant to contact an attorney. Agent Siefert makes statement regarding timelines/release. Court reviews possible waiver of right to have hearing within timelines. Further discussion regarding timelines.
from Defendant advising that motion is regarding Marinette County case nos. 14CF13 and 09CF153.
from DA to Court advising that DA's office is not involved at this point
by Defendant for release under Wisconsin Statute 302.355
Cover letter from Atty Schaefer to Court
in support of motion to withdraw
from Court to Defendant re: motion
by Defendant for release under Wisconsin Statute 302.355(2)(b)
Status conference on September 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Door County Restitution Summary
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant

Defendant Kevin K Buerke in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Kevin K Buerke in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend charge to misdemeanor theft as repeater. Court reviews max. penalties, elements.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty.  State/Defense make sentencing recommendations.  Bond no longer in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted.
Defendant in custody.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Arraignment scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin K Buerke in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Kevin K Buerke in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Bond set.
Geographical restriction:  Will extradite from adjacent states only.
